definition: to cause to be worried or upset : disquiet, unsettle
examples: Half way down the next flight, she smiled to think that a char-woman's stare should so perturb her.
The crowd didn't seem to perturb them in the slightest …

definition: to cause to experience a perturbation — see perturbation sense 2
examples: Newton finally realized that the planetary orbits would be only approximate ellipses, for the mutual attractions of the planets would perturb their paths.
